alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 14 at 11:57AM CST until December 14 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw. In southeast Mississippi, Perry and Wayne. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall is expected today into tonight over much of southeast Mississippi and southwest Alabama. Training thunderstorms will bring heavy rains of one to three inches this afternoon and tonight, with some localities possibly seeing higher amounts.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
